metadata.title: CVE-2021-47586 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:stmmac: dwmac-rk: fix oob read in rk_gmac_setup KASAN reports anout-of-bounds read in rk_gmac_setup on the line: while (ops->regs[i]) {This happens for most platforms since the regs flexible array member isempty, so the memory after the ops structure is being read here. It seemsthat mostly this happens to contain zero anyway, so we get lucky andeverything still works. To avoid adding redundant data to nearly all theops structures, add a new flag to indicate whether the regs field is validand avoid this loop when it is not.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-aws-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-azure-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
linux-gcp-fips package in fips/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
